Hi Greg,

Greg Barton wrote:

>Hello all.  I've been lurking on the list for a while, and have been
>interested in NEAT since attending GECCO 2002.  I'm just about to
>submit the following as a Sourceforge project:
>
>**** 
>
>REAT (Rete Evolution of Augmenting Topologies) is an attempt to apply
>  
>
Wish I'd thought of that acronym :)

>the concepts of Ken Stanley's NEAT (NeuroEvolution of Augmenting
>Topologies) to Charles Forgy's Rete network.   This will, hopefully,
>enable the evolution of inference rules through continual
>complexification of their underlying RETE network.
>  
>
It's not an area I know much about, although where I work we actually 
produce software that implements a rule engine - and although RETE type 
stuff  has been looked at, as far as I know we don't do anything that 
clever just yet.

Do you think there is scope for improving upon existing RETE algorithms 
or is this more of a proof of concept project?

>I intend to develop this in Java, starting from a clean implementation
>of the RETE network.
>  
>
Well good luck with that. I think this may actually be the first non 
neural net use of NEAT, unless Ken knows otherwise. I know he's often 
mentioned that the NEAT technique isn't constrained to just ANN's.

Colin.
